content.question: (a) How many miles did Chloe travel from time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> to time <math alttext="t equals 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> ?

frqParts.text: (a) How many miles did Chloe travel from time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> to time <math alttext="t equals 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> ?
(b) At time <math alttext="t equals 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, is Chloe’s speed increasing or decreasing? Give a reason for your answer.

(c) Is there a time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, at which Brandon’s acceleration is equal to <math alttext="2.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> miles per hour per hour? Justify your answer.

(d) Is there a time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, at which Brandon’s velocity is equal to Chloe’s velocity? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
